intro: Spermacoce glabra, commonly known as the smooth spermacoce, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth, black seeds. Spermacoce glabra is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas.
